title: Network issues (Telstra)

embed.description: a guest May 27th, 2018 15 in 14 days Not a member of Pastebin yet? Sign Up , it unlocks many cool features! Tracing route to 103.240.227.25 over a maximum of 30 hops 1 <1 ms <1 ms <1 ms 192.168.10.100 2 * * * Request timed out.

body:
Since approx 3 days ago I've been getting intermittent dropouts in game which is extremely frustrating as it takes up to 2 mins to reconnect.

LoL logs indicate packet loss during these times but I am not seeing anything from my network monitoring. Is there some routing issue or problem?

Would be curious to know if others are experiencing similar issues? For me, this is happening from North west Syd and is ONLY noticeable while playing league. I have been unable to replicate the packet loss to my own hardware or to Telstra.

I've attached trace routes using the testing IPs provided by Riot. Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks

replies.body:
Hi folks

Good news - we've had confirmation from Telstra that they applied some fixes to their network yesterday, which should resolve the issue.

If you've been having connectivity issues - try playing in a custom game (without VPN) and see if it is fixed.

Cheers
Mindstar
Thanks for all your help :) I don't think we could have got wit fixed without it!

Hi folks

Well we've got good news and bad news here.  The good news is that Telstra tell us that they have identified the root cause of this issue in NSW.  The bad news is that they won't be able to make any change to their network to fix the problem until some time next week.

Possible Workaround:  We believe that based on the description of the issue from Telstra, that it may be possible to bypass this issue by using a local VPN Service to connect to League.   Until they implement a fix within their network, this will be your best shot for playing League smoothly.

If anyone has access to a VPN and is willing to give it a try, I'm sure other Telstra players would love to hear from you!

Mindstar
Just played a game with a VPN and didn't have any disconnections, let's hope they don't come back :)
Which VPN service did you use? Was it difficult to set-up ?

wtfast is a pretty good free one if you're just looking for a free one to use until this gets fixed, very basic to setup and use!
let me know if there's anything I can do to help you setup whichever you choose to use

It's really sad how utterly pathetic the internet is here in Australia. When something extremely similar happened all across NA a couple years ago the issue was fixed in a day. Really sad, can't play this event, cant play clash, cant play arurf.
Any updates on a specific date the fix will occur ? "Sometime next week" doesn't really cut it for me.
You'd probably have better luck asking Telstra since they're the ones that have to do the fixing.

I do want to warn people who are not so tech savvy; a VPN will - in most cases - cause more latency in game. I tried NordVPN and it spiked from 15ms normally to 130ms or more.

I don't know if it actually fixed the issues - I struggle playing with ping greater than 80ms so 130ms wasn't worth trying. 

Thanks for all your help though Mindstar and fellow Rioters,
Hopefully you can keep us posted on when they fix the problem,
Connor.

If you can find a VPN server more local to you the ping will be lower. If you think of your normal connection as Point A to Point 1, then a VPN is Point A to Point B to Point 1. So your ping will be dependent on the physical distance from A to B to 1 instead of the normal, so if you pick a B that is far away from either you or the point you are trying to connect to your ping will be higher. 

Basically you need a VPN service that lets you pick your server and has plenty in AUS to use in case some are also affected by this connection issue.

I've been using my phone's hotspot for league only.
I had a thought.. Ya know how yo do a speed test and you can pick which server you're testing with e.g sydney server, Brisbane server etc.
Is there any way, like change how you're getting your connection from somewhere in nsw to qld. I live close enough to qld that it wouldn't effect my ping that greatly.
Use a VPN located in QLD!
I have had several games in a row using wtfast, there does seem to be some input lag, but it is definitely  playable, and no disconnects.

Sorry to hear you are having problems here.  Sending in Traceroutes is the right thing here, so thank you!  Were these taken while the issue was occurring? or at a later time?

What would really help us is to get a couple of samples - Can you provide
 - Traceroute while gameplay is normal
 - Traceroute when the dropout is happening

So we can see if the path between you and LoL changes at all.

Thanks
Mindstar

> [{quoted}](name=Agent Mindstar,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=bPfLvjTR,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-05-28T00:20:55.205+0000)
>
> Sorry to hear you are having problems here.  Sending in Traceroutes is the right thing here, so thank you!  Were these taken while the issue was occurring? or at a later time?
> 
> What would really help us is to get a couple of samples - Can you provide
>  - Traceroute while gameplay is normal
>  - Traceroute when the dropout is happening
> 
> So we can see if the path between you and LoL changes at all.
> 
> Thanks
> Mindstar

Funnily enough, the issue is significantly worse tonight than the previous days (happened 4 times in a 30-40 min game). See new pastebin link with multiple traces done during game after dropping out -> https://pastebin.com/prrEB0j7

Seeing increased latency and RTTs failing which would suggest packet loss. I think it's safe to say there is an issue that needs investigating.

Traces done while not in the middle of a dropout -> https://pastebin.com/1LJgJ2n2
Still seeing inconsistency and failed RTTs.
Any rough idea as to when this will be fixed? And will we be getting anything to compensate for all this downtime as the game is pretty much unplayable

I posted previously that I was having the same issues as everyone.

Called Telstra support and after an hour of troubleshooting, it was determined to be a hardware issue with the modem even though everything else was working completely fine.

I would suggest you all contact Telstra tech support as well as it might net better results.
I highly doubt it is hardware as it has 0 effect on any other games that i play, only League.

Hi folks

**EDIT: Thanks for all the tickets and info.  We've passed what we know on to Telstra who are investigating the fault.**

~~Updating this with a new request for information - ~~

~~Can you please send in a ticket (or update your existing one) to support, and include the following information.~~

* ~~ATTN: Agent Mindstar (so I see it!)~~
* ~~Your IP Address ( https://www.whatismyip.com/ )~~
* ~~Your Suburb~~

~~If you have collected traceroutes, please also include them.~~

Thanks
Mindstar

Hi folks,

Thanks so much for sending in your tickets with info.  The common theme here definitely looks to be Telstra / NSW.

Where things are at right now is that we've raised this with the contacts  we have at Telstra and will be continuing to monitor the situation.

As some of you have already done, it would also be worth contacting Telstra support to ensure they are aware of the issue being widespread in NSW and that your account is also affected.  You are welcome to refer them to this thread as it may help them understand the issue better (ie. It isn't just one of you).

Cheers
Mindstar
Just curious if you or Telstra have an idea of what the issue is and are trying to fix, or still trying to find what the problem is. Any info would be appreciated please as i really want to play D:

Telstra is investigating at the moment.

What we can see is our own data on in-game packetloss, by location and ISP, and from this data it looks to be localised to Telstra/NSW, but unfortunately we don't have much more visibility than this.

Cheers
Mindstar
Ok thanks, good to know something at least, even if knowing that means none of us will be playing for the next 6 months due to how bad Telstra is when it comes to these type of issues.
My ticket number is 34867658

I thought I would add that Telstra are nearly impossible to deal with as the end-user. After 45 minutes on the phone with their "Technical" Support department I was told that they believe it is a game server issue. They ran absolutely no tests and appeared to struggle with the understanding of packet loss and routing. They also supposedly do not have a networking team, or a public email address where I can send them information. Their manager reiterated that there is nothing they can do. A complaint has been raised (48 hours to hear back now yay!).

I hope Riot has a contact they can pass this info on to for investigation.

Screenshot from tonight --> https://ibb.co/g7gP8J

I live in south west sydney and I went came back from overseas to find this issue occuring with League only. I am with Telstra coincidentally and my internet is perfect, even when I disconnect my ping is still 18. Im just glad to see that something is being done as it really is a game breaking bug.

same issue; i'm located in North Shore of Sydney, Lane Cove

help me
anyway to fix it when you dont a VPN and have good connection but disconnect and reconnect every 5 minutes and it takes a minute to reconnect and aren't on telstra???
Great! Tested yesterday and all went smoothly.
I haven't gotten any disconnects the past hour or so. This is without a VPN as well. Is anyone else experiencing the same thing?

My brother just played multiple aram games (3 games) without any connectivity issues whatsoever, this was without a VPN. If you have been abstaining from playing League, I would recommend you peeps to try a game or 2 :) Maybe Telstra has fixed the issue sooner then they thought? Or maybe my brother just fit in 3 lucky games.{{sticker:galio-happy}}

Hi folks

Update here is that we've heard back from Telstra, and they are aware of the issue and investigating it.  We don't have much more information than that, but will update here when we know more.

Cheers
Mindstar
this would be great if we can get a little notice saying we have noticed issues surrounding dropouts and telstra. just on the little i when logging in.

To add a note. I have just posted my own topic about this, but didn't add the following statement.
So when this started happening to me, what I would do is go on my phone data with Optus and play the rest of the game on my hotspot and wouldn't disconnect. Unfortunately I ran out of data quickly doing so and this isn't a good option.

Funny thing is, I have been playing on NA with 220 ping and never have I had this disconnecting problem, but when I play on OCE I have 15 ping and disconnect as everyone else has every game. Its definitely not hardware related
I made a support ticket and riot are saying it's a problem from the ISP side which im doubting.

Hey dude, my brother and I are also having the same issue described by the people above. We are also with Telstra. I've played this game for over 6 years. I trust Rito to fix this, you should too :){{sticker:draven-pose}}
same issue here!! keeping an eye on this thread

Could you please provide an update regarding when this issue is solved? League has been unplayable since the 24th considering a 2 minutes dropout is approx 10% of the game in the current meta. Thank you.

There isn't much of an update we can give at this point.  It is clear that the vast majority of players affected are on Telstra, so we're going to be working with them to identify the cause.   The best thing you can do is to provide the info requested in the pinned post above, which will help Riot & Telstra engineers narrow down the part of the network that is causing it.

Cheers
Mindstar
well even though a friend and i dc at the same time we seem to retain comms when we group together in games, the comms are through the league not other comms programs
Having the exact same problem. I'm in North West of Sydney and with Telstra as well.
